metadata.case_name: Collector of Bombay v. Trustees of Lady Pochkhanawalla and others

facts.text: Lands originally known as Foras lands, rights settled by Bombay Act No. VI of 1851.
Between 1864 and 1867, Government acquired these lands for B.B. & C.I. Railway under Land Acquisition Act No. VI of 1857.
On 22-11-1938, lands sold by Governor-General to Lady Pochkhanawalla and others as joint tenants under deed Exhibit A.
On 28-3-1939, survivor of purchasers conveyed lands in trust under Exhibit B; respondents are trustees appointed under that deed.
In April 1942, appellant issued notices to respondents proposing to levy assessment under Bombay Act No. II of 1876.
Respondents replied denying right to assess, instituted suits Nos. 7 and 23 of 1943 before Revenue Judge for declaration of rights.

In plaints, respondents alleged maximum assessment under Foras Act was 9 reas per burga, no right to enhance; land acquisition extinguished even that; purchased absolutely under Exhibit A, entitled to hold revenue-free.

Revenue Judge (decree 17-03-1945) held lands vested in Government free from liability post-acquisition; transfer under Exhibit A without reservation meant no liability; declared no right to levy, notices illegal.
High Court of Bombay (judgment 10-11-1948, Chagla CJ, Bhagwati J) held Foras Act imposed specific limit; acquisition extinguished even that; transferred as revenue-free; dismissed appeal.
Assessment payable on Foras lands at time of Act VI 1851 was 9 reas per burga; collected at that rate from 1858 until acquisition (Exhibit N).
History: Island of Bombay ceded 1661, granted to East India Company 1668; reclaimed in 18th century, cultivated on favourable Foras rates.
1804: Company resumed some Foras lands; suit by Sheik Abdul Ambly failed.
Reports by Warden 1814, Le Mesurier 1843 led to Act VI 1851 recognizing occupants' rights.
One award in acquisition marked Exhibit P; compensation to claimants for their interest; no provision for Government's right to assess.
Exhibit A conveys lands absolutely with all rights, easements, appurtenances; subject to all cesses, taxes, rates, assessments, dues, duties.
Foras Act repealed by Act XIV 1870.

legal_issues.text: Whether respondents as superior holders have a right in limitation of Government's right to assess lands under section 8 of Bombay City Land Revenue Act No. II of 1876.
Effect of Foras Act No. VI of 1851 on assessment liability.
Effect of land acquisition proceedings 1864-1867 under Land Acquisition Act No. VI of 1857 on Government's right to assess.
Whether sale deed Exhibit A limits Government's right to assess.

petitioner_arguments.text: No specific limit under Foras Act; permanent tenure but not permanent assessment; right to enhance under s.8 Act II 1876; Shapurji Jivanji supports enhancement.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Bombay Act No. II of 1876 s.8; Shapurji Jivanji v. Collector of Bombay (1885) ILR 9 Bom 483

petitioner_arguments.text: Land acquisition did not extinguish Government's prerogative right to assess; only acquired private interests.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Land Acquisition Act No. VI of 1857 s.VIII; Govt of Bombay v. Esupali Salebhai (1909) ILR 34 Bom 618; Deputy Collector v. Aiyavu Pillay (1911) 9 IC 341

petitioner_arguments.text: Exhibit A absolute sale but subject to assessments; no exemption; Crown grants construed in favour of Crown.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Crown Grants Act No. XV of 1895 s.3

petitioner_arguments.text: Objected to new contention that respondents not superior holders.

respondent_arguments.text: Under Foras Act, maximum assessment 9 reas per burga, no enhancement.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Bombay Act No. VI of 1851 s.2

respondent_arguments.text: Land acquisition extinguished Government's right to assess as an interest in land; compensation paid implicitly.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Land Acquisition Act No. VI of 1857 s.VIII

respondent_arguments.text: Absolute sale under Exhibit A conveys revenue-free; s.3 Crown Grants Act supports.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Crown Grants Act No. XV of 1895 s.3; Dadoba v. Collector of Bombay (1901) ILR 25 Bom 714

respondent_arguments.text: Raised new contention: not superior holders, so s.8 inapplicable.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Bombay Act No. II of 1876 s.3(4)

respondent_arguments.text: Foras tenure incidents survived acquisition and attached to lands under Exhibit A; limited to 9 reas per burga.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Bombay Act No. VI of 1851; Collector of Bombay v. Municipal Corpn (1952 SCR 43)

court_reasoning.text: Rejected new contention on superior holder status; parties proceeded on that basis; no new facts investigation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Respondents are superior holders under s.3(4); rights per s.8 Act II 1876; onus on them to prove limitation (Goswamini Shri Kamala Vahooji).

court_reasoning.text: Foras Act extinguished Company's reversion, conferred ownership but saved rents 'now severally payable' which continue; limits to then payable 9 reas per burga.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Words 'now severally payable' and 'shall continue' limit enhancement.

court_reasoning.text: Acquisition vests land in Govt free from 'all other' estates/rights (than Govt's); prerogative right to assess not acquired, not an 'interest' in land; no valuation/compensation for it.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Govt acquires only private interests; sovereign right paramount.

court_reasoning.text: Exhibit A absolute but subject to assessments expressly; no recital revenue-free; Crown Grants Act s.3 saves conditions repugnant to TP Act, inapplicable; Dadoba distinguished (estoppel there).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Clause subjects to 'all cesses, taxes, rates, assessments...'; no exemption.

court_reasoning.text: Foras tenure extinguished by acquisition; lands sold as freehold, not Foras; Foras Act repealed 1870, no subsisting rights.

holdings.text: No limitation on Govt's right to assess under s.8 Act II 1876; Foras Act limit accepted but overridden by later events.
Foras Act conferred specific right to assessment not exceeding 9 reas per burga.
Land acquisition did not extinguish Govt's right to assess.
Exhibit A does not exempt from assessment.

precedents_cited.case_name: Goswamini Shri Kamala Vahooji v. Collector of Bombay
precedents_cited.relevance: s.8 allows plea of no right to assess; onus on superior holder.

precedents_cited.case_name: Shapurji Jivanji v. Collector of Bombay
precedents_cited.relevance: Govt right to enhance Foras assessments.

precedents_cited.case_name: Govt of Bombay v. Esupali Salebhai
precedents_cited.relevance: Govt need not acquire/pay for own interest in acquisition.

precedents_cited.case_name: Deputy Collector, Calicut v. Aiyavu Pillay
precedents_cited.relevance: Acquisition only of interests not belonging to Govt.
Estoppel/contract from correspondence; not absolute sale implying revenue-free.

precedents_cited.case_name: Thakur Jagannath Baksh Singh v. United Provinces
precedents_cited.relevance: Crown Grants Act s.3 read in context of preamble, limited scope.

precedents_cited.case_name: Collector of Bombay v. Municipal Corpn of City of Bombay
precedents_cited.relevance: Immunity as incident of prescriptive title; not surviving acquisition.
Construction of Crown grants by intention from language.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay City Land Revenue Act No. II of 1876
statutes_cited.relevance: Authority to levy assessment; superior holders' rights limiting it.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Foras Act No. VI of 1851
statutes_cited.relevance: Extinguished reversion, saved 'rents now severally payable'; no exemption from general taxes.

statutes_cited.name: Land Acquisition Act No. VI of 1857
statutes_cited.relevance: Vesting free from all other estates/rights; did not affect Govt's assessment right.

statutes_cited.name: Crown Grants Act No. XV of 1895
statutes_cited.relevance: Provisions/restrictions in grants take effect per tenor; limited to TP Act doubts.

statutes_cited.name: Land Acquisition Act No. I of 1894
statutes_cited.relevance: Analogous; no acquisition of Govt interest.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Act No. XIV of 1870
statutes_cited.relevance: Repealed Foras Act; saved accrued rights (none subsisting).

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; lower courts reversed. Held no limitation on appellant's right to levy assessment under s.8 Bombay City Land Revenue Act 1876; respondents' claims rejected.
outcome.relief_granted: Right to levy assessment affirmed without limitation.

key_quotes.text: "When there is a right on the part of the superior holder in limitation of the right of Government... the assessment shall not exceed such specific limit."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Quotes s.8 Act II 1876 central to dispute.

key_quotes.text: "the lands vest... free from all other estates, rights, titles and interests."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Key to holding acquisition did not extinguish Govt assessment right.

key_quotes.text: "the true import... is that while... the right of the Government to recover the assessment is saved, it is... limited to the amount then payable."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "the right to impose a tax on land is a prerogative right of the Crown, paramount to the ownership."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes assessment right from acquirable interests.
